mads.note: Brill's New Pauly: "Sostratus, of Nysa, 1st cent. BC, from a renowned family of grammarians, . taught Strabo and wrote geographical works incorporating plentiful mythological material (sparsely quoted in Stobaeus and Plutarch): On Rivers, 2 vols.; Tyrrhēniká, Thrakiká; Mythikḕs historías synagōgḗ (mythological accounts). S. also wrote Kynēgetiká ('On Hunting', Stob. 4,20b = FGrH 23 F 4 = SH 735)..." Sostratus”, in: Brill’s New Pauly, Antiquity volumes edited by: Hubert Cancik and , Helmuth Schneider.
